explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

flammable_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive or self-reactive properties

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Organic compounds containing oxygen (but not fluorine and chlorine), with the oxygen bound to carbon and hydrogen (but not to other elements)

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (oral route) value of 9,900mg/kg (MOE Risk Assessment vol. 2).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on the rabbit LD50 (dermal route) value of >10,000mg/kg (CERI Hazard Data 2000-48 (2001)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is "liquid" according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: Based on the guinea pig LD50 (4 hours) value of 0.026mg/L (equivalent to 2.4ppm), calculated from the testing data of guinea pig LC50 (1-hour inhalation) of 0.051mg/L (MOE Risk Assessment vol. 2 (2003)), was lower than 90% of the saturated vapour concentration (20ppm) under a saturated vapour pressure of 2.1*10^-3 Pa (25degC), the substance was considered as "vapour containing substantially no mist" and was classified based on standard values of gas.

skin_corrosion_irritation.hazard_statement: Causes severe skin burns and eye damage
skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on rabbit skin irritation tests (ACGIH (7th, 2001)): "The substance produced severe skin irritation." Also based on the description in the report on guinea pig skin irritation tests: "severe erythema and edema were observed." Although the substance, as a severe skin irritant, is classified into Category 1-2 in the absence of data on reversibility, it should be placed in Category 1 from the viewpoint of safety.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on rabbit eye irritation tests (RTECS (2005)): "Severely irritating." Although classified as Category 1-2A in the absence of data on reversibility, the substance should be placed in Category 1 from the viewpoint of safety.

germ_cell_mutagenicity.hazard_statement: May cause an allergic skin reaction
germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on the description in the report on guinea pig skin sensitization tests (ACGIH (7th, 2001)): "Skin sensitization: positive." Also based on three cases of skin sensitization reported in human epidemiological studies (MOE Risk Assessment vol. 2).

carcinogenicity.rationale: Classification not possible due to the insufficiently of data (no data available on in vivo mutagenicity/genotoxicity tests)

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: Causes damage to organs (nervous system, respiratory system)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the human evidence including "obstructive impairment of pulmonary function" (MOE Risk Assessment vol. 2 (2003)), and the evidence from animal studies including "respiratory effects with tremor and spasm, severe pulmonary congestion and edema" (CERI Hazard Data 2000-48 (2001)). The effects on experimental animals were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 1.

aspiration_hazard.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since a potential that relevant toxicity was discovered in the water solubility (0.121mg/L(PHYSPROP Database, 2005)) of this substance cannot be denied from 96-hour LC50=1.2mg/L of tthe fish (Zebrafish) (CERI Hazard Data, 2002), it was classified into Category 1.

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Although acute toxicity is Category 1 and bio-accumulation is low (log Kow=2.14(CERI Hazard Data, 2002)), since there was no rapidly degrading (the decomposition by BOD: 0%(Existing Chemical Safety Inspections Data)), it was classified into Category 1.
